basics.label: Passenger Service Concourse Manager
basics.summary: A dedicated and enthusiastic leader, able to motivate employees to perform at their best in providing excellent service and developing ongoing, profitable client relationships. Creative, resourceful and flexible, able to adapt to changing priorities and maintain a positive attitude and strong work ethic.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Managing daily operation while driving safety policies. Directly responsible for overseeing 8 to 24 zone leaders. Maintained and provided daily schedule to dispatchers and senior leaders.
highlights: Maintaining the appearance of equipment utilized throughout the day
Communicating, training and pushing operational changes as directed
Maintaining healthy working environment while working in busy atmosphere
Fulfilling customer request regularly, in a timely manner
Coaching and counseling employees
Recognizing employees
Challenging delays
Revamping processes when necessary
Providing hands on team work
Focusing on dress code policy and employee professionalism

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Managed 10 to 14 team of 3 man employees. Responsible for building 7 day schedule for employees. Communicated and managed dispatcher.
highlights: Managing up to 35 team leaders directly
Responsible for coaching, counseling and documenting employees
Responsible for managing processes regarding CBP
Pushing safety policies regularly

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Assistant manager in scheduling employees. Executed directives provided leadership. Support team leaders with assistant on aircraft as needed.
highlights: Provided safety patrol on the ramp and concourse daily
Held briefing to communicate information pasted down by management
Trained employees to become team leaders and service aircraft

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Maintained the appearance of equipment utilized in operations. Assistant manager in scheduling employees. Executed directives provided leadership. Support team leaders with assistant on aircraft as needed.
highlights: Provided safety patrol on the ramp and concourse daily
Held briefing to communicate information pasted down by management
Trained employees to become team leaders and service aircraft

skills.name: Leadership
keywords: Ability to work on a team
